verses.text: For the end, a Psalm \add and\add* Song of David.
Praise becomes thee, O God, in Sion; and to thee shall the vow be performed.
Hear my prayer; to thee all flesh shall come.
The words of transgressors have overpowered us; but do thou pardon our sins.
Blessed \add is he\add* whom thou hast chosen and adopted; he shall dwell in thy courts; we shall be filled with the good things of thy house; thy temple is holy.
\add Thou art\add* wonderful in righteousness. Hearken to us, O God our Saviour; the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them \add that are\add* on the sea afar off:
who dost \f + \fr 64:7 \fqa Gr. \ft prepare.\f*establish the mountains in thy strength, being girded about with power;
who troublest the depth of the sea, the sounds of its waves.
The nations shall be troubled, and they that inhabit the ends \add of the earth\add* shall be afraid of thy signs; thou wilt cause the outgoings of morning and evening to rejoice.
Thou hast visited the earth, and saturated it; thou hast abundantly enriched it. The river of God is filled with water; thou hast prepared their food, for thus is the preparation \add of it\add*.
Saturate her furrows, multiply her fruits; \add the crop\add* springing up shall rejoice in its drops.
Thou wilt bless the crown of the year \add because\add* of thy goodness; and thy plains shall be filled with fatness.
The mountains of the wilderness shall be enriched; and the hills shall gird themselves with joy.
The rams of the flock are clothed \add with wool\add*, and the valleys shall abound in corn; they shall cry aloud, yea they shall sing hymns.
